title: Dependency Injection C# and ASP.NET with Unity

First why we should use depedency injection in our code ? We want to decouple other components from other classes in our program. For example we have class AnimalController which have code like this :

inline_content.Text: First why we should use depedency injection in our code ? We want to decouple other components from other classes in our program. For example we have class AnimalController which have code like this :

title: We look at this code and we think everything is ok but now our AnimalController is reliant on object _SantaAndHisReindeer. Automatically my Controller is bad to testing and reusability of my code will be very hard.

inline_content.Text: We look at this code and we think everything is ok but now our AnimalController is reliant on object _SantaAndHisReindeer. Automatically my Controller is bad to testing and reusability of my code will be very hard.

title: If we want Unity to handle DI, the road to achieve this is very simple :) With NuGet( package manager) we can easily import unity to our code.

inline_content.Text: If we want Unity to handle DI, the road to achieve this is very simple :) With NuGet( package manager) we can easily import unity to our code.

title: in Visual Studio Tools -> NuGet Package Manager -> Manage Packages for Solution -> in search input write unity -> choose our project-> click install

inline_content.Text: in Visual Studio Tools -> NuGet Package Manager -> Manage Packages for Solution -> in search input write unity -> choose our project-> click install

title: Now two files with nice comments will be created.

inline_content.Text: Now two files with nice comments will be created.

title: in App-Data folder UnityConfig.cs and UnityMvcActivator.cs

inline_content.Text: in App-Data folder UnityConfig.cs and UnityMvcActivator.cs

title: UnityConfig - in RegisterTypes method, we can see type that will be injection in our constructors.

inline_content.Text: UnityConfig - in RegisterTypes method, we can see type that will be injection in our constructors.

title: UnityMvcActivator - > also with nice comments which say that this class integrates Unity with ASP.NET MVC

inline_content.Text: UnityMvcActivator - > also with nice comments which say that this class integrates Unity with ASP.NET MVC

title:
FilterProviders.Providers.Remove(FilterProviders.Providers.OfType<FilterAttributeFilterProvider>().First());
        FilterProviders.Providers.Add(new UnityFilterAttributeFilterProvider(container));
DependencyResolver.SetResolver(new UnityDependencyResolver(container));
Now we can decouple our Controller from class SantAndHisReindeer :)

inline_content.Text: Now we can decouple our Controller from class SantAndHisReindeer :)

title: There is one final thing we must do before running our application.

inline_content.Text: There is one final thing we must do before running our application.

title: In Global.asax.cs we must add new line: UnityWebActivator.Start() which will start, configure Unity and register our types.

inline_content.Text: In Global.asax.cs we must add new line: UnityWebActivator.Start() which will start, configure Unity and register our types.
